Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToTravel_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet area, 30 min of walking from Atocha train/metro station and 30-40 min of walking from the Prado Museum. Considering the prices that were in the city center this hotel was a very good price quality deal. The room was very clean, the toiletries products good, the breakfast (which we had it included in the room price) was also rich so till now no downsides but it is important to mention that in the lobby we had free access to Wi-Fi only 1h/day. This was not a pleasant surprise as we knew from the beginning we will have free internet in the lobby, we didn't expected to be limited to 1h. And another minus was the temperature in the room. I have read other reviews mentioning that it was very hot in their room. I would like to mention that in our room was cold in the night. We had a button for adjusting the heat in the room but it didn't seem to work. Maybe it would be good if each room could adjust its own heat. The persons from the reception were kind and willing to help. Overall if it would be to go again to Madrid we would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only a short bus ride away from the museums”
Reviews.Author: SandieBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet part of Madrid, but only a short metro/bus ride away from the museums and the centre. Near to Atocha railway station. Very good 3 star accommodation, clean and friendly. Very good/cheap for visitors with cars that need secure parking. Free Wi-Fi in reception area. Breakfast a bit pricey, but lots of cafes nearby - one cafe on Caceras Street has breakfast offer for 3 euros (toast, coffee & fresh OJ) and it's on the way to the metro/bus.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel location and room”
Reviews.Author: thevividtraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated 25 mins away from Atocha station - which is not easy to find. Couple of stations away from the city centre - maximum of 18-20 mins travel time if going to city by bus and direct access to the M-30. The hotel is 25-30 mins by walk from the city's artistic and cultural heart (Museo del Prado, Reina Sofía, and the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection). Hotel has wifi service in common area i.e., lobby- none in the room The room that we stayed in was in poor state. It looks like an old motel room. The room had an old tv. The carpet not in really good state. The lady receptionist was nice. She gave us map and directions. The male receptionist who replaced her was not so very helpful. So after seeing the state of the room and how much effort we needed to get to the city centre we decided to look for another hotel at the city centre - it was a good decision!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, poor location - but fantastic selection of toiletries!”
Reviews.Author: UncleOswald
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for four nights over New Year. The staff were helpful - Racquel was particularly good, she recommended us where to go for chocolate and churros and how best to get to the various museums we wanted to visit. The location however, is not great. It's around a ten-fifteen minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Delicias) and then a ten minute ride into town. It's not ridiculously far, but if you're only in Madrid on a short city break, you do spend quite a bit of time just getting into the city centre. It's also not so close to Atocha station - that's around a fifteen-twenty minute walk along a busy main road. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as I found it rather overpriced - there are coffee shops nearby, but I ended up buying some ham, cheese and bread in a supermarket and eating this for breakfast each day. The rooms were pretty average. They were clean and the bathroom toiletries were fantastic - sponges, shoe polisher, a razor, toothbrushes and toothpaste, cologne - along with the usual shampoo, body wash and shower caps. The shower was powerful and the bathroom was spotless. My room was also clean - the bed was comfy enough, but the carpets and curtains were outdated and the view was...well, there was no view. But the room was clean and the bed was comfy enough - if you're only staying for a couple of days, it's perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you want lots of exercise!”
Reviews.Author: Loudot79
Reviews.Content: We visited Madrid for a long weekend on 8th September and stayed at this hotel as the reviews were pretty good. The room was fine, nothing to complain about there. The area was not. Firstly, it says on their website that they are next to Atocha station... they are nowhere near Atocha station! The closest underground station is 5 blocks away and it's not as far as Atocha station. There are very, very few restaurants in the area and we were told that the hotel restaurant was closed on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights, although it advertised in the hotel that it was open every night. This meant wandering around trying to find a decent place to eat. In the end we used taxis to get to and from Central Madrid to find some decent food. The night before we left we asked at reception if we could use the computer to check in online and the receptionist gave us a voucher with a password on, all well and good. When I asked if we could print out our boarding passes he said there was no printer although he was standing next to one. We tried to check in anyway but the website was in Spanish, obviously. Having very little Spanish we clicked the facility to translate the site to English, but hey, guess what, it didn't work. We checked in next morning at the airport! If we aver return to Madrid, which I doubt, we will certainly not be staying at the Atocha.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DavidfromOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice on our way to / from Morocco. Both times the rooms were excellent, spotlessly clean and of a very high standard for a 3 star hotel. I've stayed in some 4 star hotels that haven't been as good as this, its at least 3.5 stars. Fantastic bathroooms complete with lots of free toiletries, and rooms were well insulated from any street noise. Location is a 20 minute hike straight up the road to the main railway station (also an historic icon) and the cultural precinct with all its parks and the Royal Botanic gardens, as well as the amazing Prada museum. If the walk is a bit much, it's easy to get a taxi. WiFi is available but you have to buy it, although you can get it for free in the foyer area. Breakfast isn't included and seemed very expensive, so we ate at cafes in the street. Staff are helpful and friendly and were very efficient organising a taxi to the airport - which is a looong way away. In summary, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but no english speaking”
Reviews.Author: essgee-inde
Reviews.Content: the hotel was given to me as four star but it is not. Can not carry heavy baggage no ramp at the entrance, it ha sonly steps. Just average stay. hotel employees not friendly. no wifi for free. which can really leave you stranded.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location and price”
Reviews.Author: alikat32
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in March 2011 for a short break in Madrid. Although the Metro stations are 10-15 minutes walk away there is a bus stop almost outside the hotel door and just hop on there, number 55 or 60 will drop you right outside various metro stations - no need to walk anywhere. Just buy the tourist metro ticket for 3 days and you never have to pay for buses or metros even to the airport. Because of this we found the location quite convenient and travelled easily all over the city. The room was a bit small and dark and looked out onto a central well, but it was comfortable and clean and the bathroom was very well equipped. Staff were very helpful and we were able to leave our luggage all day before going to the airport. Breakfast was good with plenty to choose from. I would stay there again without any worries. Not luxurious but good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Well... think it twice before staying here...”
Reviews.Author: Goguca
Reviews.Content: This is a very average hotel that left us very disappointed. Despite of its name and description, the building is not really close to Atocha, especially if you are dragging your bags. It is a 25 minutes walking from there and the closest metro station is Delicias, which is approx. 12 to 15 mins. walking. We booked the hotel through Expedia and the offer said “wi-fi” as one of the special features of the package we bought. However, when we arrived to the hotel, the receptionist just said (in those rude Spanish manners) that we had to pay for the internet, even in the computer located in the lobby (5 EUR for 45 mins… in the locutorios 5 mins walking is 35 cents for 45 minutes). To make things worse, when we checked out we were asked to pay again ignoring the booking already made and paid through Expedia. The receptionist didn’t even know the existence of Expedia and refused to believe that you have to pay beforehand in a booking of this kind. This is particularly impressive for a hotel that seems to be part of a wide chain in Spain and other European countries. When we arrived at 1 a.m. to the hotel, the front entrance was closed and the receptionist came, with the guests’ list printed to check our names before letting us in through a side door by the parking entrance. Very below average, isn’t it? Re the room, it was good, clean and with many toiletries. However, I wouldn’t recommend this hotel, I am sure you find better deals out there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: London078
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst on a weekend break in Madrid. We were looking for a reaonsably prices, decent hotel for the three days, and the Hotel Abba Atocha was better than I expected. The hotel is in a nice area, and we felt very safe the entire time. The closest Metro station is Delicias (10 mins away), and Atocha station is about 20 mins walk away. It isn't quite in the centre of town, but is easily accessible and we didnt have a problem getting around at all. The hotel lobby is very nice, and looks more like a 4 star hotel from the entrance. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was slightly disappointing as it was quite small, but the bathroom was huge - as big as the room in fact and made up for it. We were on the 9th floor, and unfortunately we could hear the loud rumbling sound of the lift everytime it went up and down which wasnt very pleasant. All in all I enjoyed staying there. The only thing I would criticise is the restaurant. There are two restaurants, one inside the hotel, and the other just at the side of the hotel, which is also owned by the hotel. We went to the one on the side of the hotel, and was disappointed to pay 15euros for each meal considering they had clearly been microwaved. Plus we were charged for two bread rolls we didnt ask for!

Reviews.Title: “they stole our boots”
Reviews.Author: zamral
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for the new years eve 2007-2008.the location was good the breakfast also, BUT they stole our shoes.when we went to the reception to asked them if they know something the clerk wa very RUDE and told us it wasn't his problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: Bananasaboutravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abba Atocha Madrid for one night in May. It was very clean, quiet and we were given an enormous room with sitting room with lounge and separate bedroom. The hotel is a 3 star but the furnishings are as good as some 4 star hotels I have stayed in. The breakfast was fine but nothing spectacular. The only negative I have about this hotel is the location. You really need to use the metro to get into the centre of Madrid and the station was closed for renovation when we were there so we had to use the bus instead. Overall it was very good value for money and the staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice but poor location”
Reviews.Author: Stocktondave
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice and I would recommend it. However our room was next to the lift & so quite noisy and we had a view of the air conditioning unit from our window & so no natural light. The nearest tube line(3), which would be 5 minute walk is under repair & so the nearest tube was 15 minute walk. Once this is up and running the location wouldn't be too bad. It was approx 25 mins walk from Atocha station. The breakfast buffet was well varied & stocked if you got up early enough.

HotelInfo.Name: Abba Atocha Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo Santa Maria de la Cabeza, 73, 28045 Madrid, Spain
